definition: one side/one aspect/simultaneously... (and...)/one's whole face
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
one side of the story/one-sided statement
to be entirely on one side/one-sided/lopsided/partisan/overwhelmingly on one side
to have met once/casual acquaintance

sentences.english: While she could be strict, she could also be a real “softie.
sentences.chinese: 她既有嚴厲的一面，同時也真的是一個感性的人。

sentences.english: Knowing your own darkness is the most prhvacticing way for deinging with the darknesses of other people.
sentences.chinese: 理解自身的暗淡，是對待他人暗淡一面的最好方法。

sentences.english: Confucius about drinking water and a single scoop sparse Louxiang refers only to this aspect.
sentences.chinese: 孔子談疏食飲水和單瓢陋巷指的都只是此一面。

sentences.english: More guards, carrying six wooden coffins, made their way to a wall on the prison's seaward side.
sentences.chinese: 又有幾個守衛扛着六具棺木朝監獄靠海的一面牆走去。

sentences.english: Thus man restrains himself from the evil doings and does good things.
sentences.chinese: 人於是就收斂起自己惡的一面，於是就積善行德。

sentences.english: The Five Humoresques reveal Reger in lighter mode.
sentences.chinese: 五首幽默小品則顯示出其輕快的一面。

sentences.english: Side mirrors are replaced by external cameras, located above the rear fenders .
sentences.chinese: 一面鏡子取代外部攝像機，上方後方墊。
幸福伴侶總是強調積極的一面。

sentences.english: Sprung axlebox side of rear truck.
sentences.chinese: 車的後部彈簧軸箱的一面。

sentences.english: A partition surfaced in foil wall covering stands in lieu of a headboard.
sentences.chinese: 一面金屬箔片飾面的隔牆替代了牀頭板原先的位置。

sentences.english: He hesitated and added, the muscles of his face contracting whitely.
sentences.chinese: 他一臉的肌肉在皺縮發白，一面吞吞吐吐地接下去說。

sentences.english: The Hong Kong team also won a bronze medal in the water ski team event.
sentences.chinese: 香港隊在滑水隊際賽中同時亦奪得一面銅牌。

sentences.english: He will not see your one side, vast bump of the hurl enter the trap of the love.
sentences.chinese: 他不會見你一面，就莽莽撞撞的投進愛情的陷阱。

sentences.english: I think the other piece of it is the loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 我想這個問題的另一面就是孤獨。

sentences.english: I met her once several years ago.
sentences.chinese: 幾年前我曾見過她一面。

sentences.english: That might be how you're more familiar with cyanide.
sentences.chinese: 大家可能對氰化物的這一面更加熟悉。

definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
both sides
abbr. of 麵包車的士|面包车的士[mian4 bao1 che1 di1 shi4]/minivan taxi
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
front/obverse side/right side/positive/direct/open
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/CL:個|个[ge4]/simultaneously
suffix of a noun of locality
one block/one piece/one (unit of money)/together/in the same place/in company
reverse side/backside/the other side (of a problem etc)/negative/bad
either side/both sides
outside/outer surface/abroad/place other than one's home
cautious and solemn (idiom); very carefully/prudent/gently and cautiously
often/frequently
look/style/appearance/approximation/about/CL:個|个[ge4]/also pr. [mo2 yang4]
in front of/facing/(in the) presence (of)
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
